meanings.definition: To act together or in conjunction with another
meanings.sent1: The students coact on the project to finish it faster.
meanings.sent2: The team members coact to achieve their common goal.
meanings.sent3: The siblings coact to plan a surprise party for their parents.
meanings.sent4: The waves and wind coact to create a powerful storm.
meanings.sent5: The dancers coact in perfect harmony during the performance.

meanings.definition: To compel or force someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher coacts the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The law can coact individuals to follow certain rules.
meanings.sent3: The magician coacts the audience to participate in the magic show.
meanings.sent4: The coach coacts the players to give their best in the game.
meanings.sent5: The parents coact their children to tidy up their room before bedtime.
